instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data: Replace old and dilapidated dry walls. For areas with paint film, scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually. For repainting substrates with chalky old paint, use BOYSEN®® Chalk Blocker™ B‑7304 as surface conditioner. In case of mildew infestation, treat with a bleach solution (1:3, laundry bleach to water, respectively) by swabbing or brushing. To ensure proper treatment, let stand for 24 hours before cleaning off residue. Let dry. Surface to be repainted should be clean and dry, free from dust and dirt and all possible contaminants.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Primer: BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Flat Latex B‑701 Putty: BOYSEN®® Masonry Putty B‑7311 Colored Basecoat (2 coats): BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Flat Latex (any desired plant-mixed color) Decorative Topcoat: Using a DECORe™ brush, apply Sandino™ in light, crisscrossing strokes, spreading it as evenly as possible. Avoid lap marks by applying the product in sections. Leave a small gap in between the sections then just spot apply Sandino™ on the gaps right after to even it out.

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: DECORe™ Sandino™ should only be applied as a decorative finish on surfaces that are properly painted with a flat topcoat. For best results, the color of the flat topcoat should complement the effect of Sandino™ Gold or Sandino™ Silver. Only use the provided BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Brush. The desired finish may not be achieved if a different material is used.
